page.title: 04Worship, Brickhill, Bedford
page.content: The area is served by{St.Mark's {Anglican/Methodist Church}in Calder Rise and by{St.Philip & St.James R.C. {Church}in Waveney Avenue. A{Baptist {Church}is nearby in Brickhill Drive. Other denominations meet locally in school halls and in the Brickhill Community Centre, Avon Drive. The churches work together and do not try to rival each other. They also provide accommodation for group meetings of a wide variety, such as Playgroups, Open House, Guides, Brownies, Aerobics and Slimming Clubs. The minister of St.Marks said that between seventy and eighty people attend worship on an average Sunday morning. Because most of the houses are occupied by young marrieds, he conducts thirty to forty baptisms each year but only six to ten weddings. He expects this to increase in time.
